event.title: was named by the Central Pacific Railroad Boca (Spanish for "mouth" and "river mouth") in 1867

data.event: The place was named by the Central Pacific Railroad Boca (Spanish for "mouth" and "river mouth") in 1867 because it was near the mouth of the Little Truckee River.
Boca has a fairly typical climate for its region, a continental Mediterranean climate (Köppen Dsb), with dry summers that feature hot days and cold nights, and cold, snowy winters.
